title: The Block's Mark slams rival Jesse and accuses him of 'bullying' as they get into a heated clash
text:
The Block's 'villain' Jesse had a dramatic showdown with host Scott Cam on Monday.

And on Tuesday's episode, Jesse had yet another heated spat - this time with rivals Mitch and Mark.

The real estate agent fired up when the pair's builder reminded him that he owed them two hours of painting, before Mark said he didn't want anything to do with Jesse and accused him of 'bullying'.

'I don't want anything to do with him!' The Block's Mitch and Mark slam rival Jesse (pictured) and accuse him of 'bullying' as they get into a heated clash over a painting dispute

Jesse claimed that he didn't owe the 'stylish grandads' two hours of painting, as he did some corking in their apartment and they told him not to worry about the rest.

When Mark first heard that Jesse thought he didn't owe them anything, he got angry, saying: 'At the moment, I don't give a f**k anymore, I don't want anything to do with him!'

He added to camera about Jesse: 'He doesn't listen, he doesn't listen to Scott who has 30 years building experience.'

Clash: When Mark (pictured) first heard that Jesse thought he didn't owe them anything, he got angry, saying: 'At the moment, I don't give a f**k anymore...'

'He bombards people, and doesn't listen, it's quite a bullying tactic. And that's why I don't want to discuss it with Jesse. He seems to go on the attack and we're not interested in that.'

At one point, Jesse tried to confront Mark in front of the camera crew, and Mark said he thought Jesse was trying to 'make himself look better' on TV.

'He doesn't want to talk about it because he knows he's wrong,' Jesse defiantly said, before saying that Mitch and Mark should 'get over it'.

Showdown: Jesse claimed that he didn't owe the 'stylish granddads' two hours of painting, as he did some corking in their apartment and they told him not to worry about the rest

Earlier in the week, Jesse had a spat with host Scott Cam over a $600 carpentry bill.

He failed to heed the host's construction warnings for his verandas, which resulted in a costly mistake to fix.

'Now, have you heard of a word called improvisation? Because that's exactly what you have to do in carpentry,' Scott told Jesse.

But Jesse explained it was the 'boys' who built the ceiling 100 millimeters out, meaning he shouldn't be held responsible.

Fighting with the boss! On the show on Monday meanwhile, Jesse had a spat with host Scott Cam (R) over a $600 carpentry bill

Jesse continued to blame the show's tradies, saying indignantly: 'So we have to check everything your carpenters do?'

'Of course you do!' Scott replied, once again reiterating that the teams must take responsibility for their own renovations.

The argument between the two men ended with Scott storming off the building site, after flatly refusing to pay Jesse's carpentry bill.
description: The Block's 'villain' Jesse had a dramatic showdown with host Scott Cam on Monday.
